channel.title: Abilities
channel.description:
The new RS is certainly a piece of work, but I don't really like it due to the abilities. They make the game more challenging and interactive due to the situation based use of certain abilities, which is amazing. The abilities aren't as great as I expected, because they aren't as efficient as I thought they would be. It seems like most of the abilities are for monsters with more health than usual, due to the long cool-down times of most spells. I've taken a look at all the spells, and they are really neat; however, they didn't really perform as great as I thought.
A couple of builds I thought of were [b]slice-and-dice[/b] and [b]affliction[/b]. There is no official build names for these because I thought of the names due to the certain activities in a fight.
[b]Slice-and-dice[/b]:
[ul][li]Constantly using spells that are at your resource to output the most damage in a short period of time[/li] [li]Abilities used should be based on the cool-down (long to short), so there will be a possible chance to use more powerful abilities more than once[/li][/ul]
[b]Affliction:[/b]
[ul][li]Always use abilities that apply damage over a set amount of time[/li] [li]The main source of damage is derived from the abilities that have DoTs (damage over time)[/li][/ul]
Even with the builds above, the actual rotation of abilities used should always be tweaked due to variety of gear and monster type, or maybe even personal preference. I've tried both builds and I've tested different situations and rotations of each build, but I've yet to conclude a 'good' standing of ability importance. This is just my opinion, because I'm sure other people have adapted to abilities nicely, even if it is due to the type of armor and weapons you use.

item.title: Abilities
item.dc:creator: @Rodgerwilco Rodgerwilco
item.description:
@Rodgerwilco wrote:

log into rs to check out graphics and to see what is going on. Hit up the wild and was 1 hit… you guys call this pking…

Read full topic

item.title: Abilities
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

[quote=“Tutorial, post:3, topic:469867”][quote author=Tmesis link=topic=587179.msg4168572#msg4168572 date=1353981735]
I went PKing as a pure ranger (combat level 20) and would just get 1 hit all the time by people my own level, it’s whoever gets their ultimate first. I found it ridiculously annoying and logged off.
[/quote]
It is by far one of the worst combat systems I’ve ever seen in a game before.[/quote]
Yes, it is nearly as bad as the old one.

Read full topic

item.title: Abilities
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

Tmesis:

I went PKing as a pure ranger (combat level 20) and would just get 1 hit all the time by people my own level, it’s whoever gets their ultimate first. I found it ridiculously annoying and logged off.

Can you see the other players adrenaline bar above their head? If so, when it gets near full use a defensive ability that blocks a percentage of damage, and then stun them so you get some extra time for your ultimate.

Read full topic

item.title: Abilities
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

The new RS is certainly a piece of work, but I don’t really like it due to the abilities. [ul][li]Constantly using spells that are at your resource to output the most damage in a short period of time[/li]
[li]Abilities used should be based on the cool-down (long to short), so there will be a possible chance to use more powerful abilities more than once[/li][/ul]

Affliction:

[ul][li]Always use abilities that apply damage over a set amount of time[/li]
[li]The main source of damage is derived from the abilities that have DoTs (damage over time)[/li][/ul]

This is just my opinion, because I’m sure other people have adapted to abilities nicely, even if it is due to the type of armor and weapons you use.
